problem: In kite $WXZY$, $m\angle W = 120^{\circ}, m\angle X = 20^{\circ}$ and $WY = YZ$. What is $m\angle Y$?
solution: In a kite, the two sets of adjacent edges are equal. Since $WY = YZ$, angles $W$ and $Z$ are equal. Hence, $m\angle Y = 360^{\circ} - m\angle W - m\angle Z - m\angle X  = 360^{\circ} - 120^{\circ} - 120^{\circ} - 20^{\circ} = \boxed{100^{\circ}}$.
